result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel N. Meindl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Follow all rules of Drug Treatment Court.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel N. Meindl in court, in custody. Attorney Andrea M. Will appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is a new DTC participant - State has no objection to stay of the balance of the condition time on 14CF699. 
Court stays the balance of the condition time on 14CF699 EFFECTIVE October 22, 2014 - is to be released BY 8:00 am on October 22, 2014 DIRECTLY to WCS Staff. Bail has been paid/posted on 14CF199 already.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daniel N. Meindl in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 93 days if revoked.
- 1 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Follow all rules of Drug Treatment Court.

CONDITION TIME: 20 days jail - To commence forthwith.  Condition time may be stayed by Judge Domina through Drug Treatment Court after defendant's first appearance.


Count 2:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 93 days if revoked.
- 1 years Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.
Plea hearing on October 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel N. Meindl in court, in custody, with attorney Sam Benedict for Katie Beth Bricco.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests time to review the consolidated offer.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on October 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel.
Plea hearing on September 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Plea hearing on August 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.
